Posts.Content: May 28, 2010 04:07PM badmamajama wrote: My first chemo I took a portable DVD player and watched a movie.-Well kinda watched a movie really mostly watched what was going on around me. I would take a book or magazine at first until you meet someone. I met a wonderful woman who had the same treatment plan and days  as I did and it was much easier to pass the time talking to a friend. Sending prayers your way on Thurs.
Posts.Title: So new to this! Jennypoo photobug

Posts.Content: Jan 29, 2012 04:28PM badmamajama wrote: After my first treatment, I cut my hair short. On day 13, my scalp started to tingle. I decided to have a few close friends over and each one took a turn cutting my hair. My best friend shaved it all off. We had pizza and drinks -made it more like a ladies night. I guess I was lucky losing my hair didn't really bother me. I felt empowered--like the chemo was working and I was going to beat the "beast"
Posts.Title: How did you deal with losing your hair? taraw413 lorenar

Posts.Content: badmamajama wrote: I finished chemo last July(09) and still receiving Herceptin. My feet hurt in the mornings and if I over do it--too much working  on my feet or too much tennis. I had numb feet and hands during chemo--Taxotere and AC. My hands are fine now but my feet feel like I am wearing an Iron boot. Sometimes it hard standing up and walking. Does this sound like neurapothy? My ono said she feels my foot pain is not a side effect from chemo or Herceptin and wants me to see a neurologist. Any advise? Dx 2/2009, IDC, ER-/PR-, HER2+ Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: neurapothy badmamajama SoCalLisa

Posts.Content: Mar 21, 2010 03:16PM badmamajama wrote: I can relate  to all of your feelings. It is all so overwhelming in the beginning. I don't post here often but I read the threads alot . There many fabulous ladies here that can answer your questions and provide support.  I had my bilat in Sept 09 with expanders and just had my exchange in Feb. 10. If you have any questions and want to pm me --please feel free.  Good thoughts and prayers for your surgery tomorrow.
Posts.Title: Breast Cancer @ 34 abass2010 ambyrp

Posts.Content: Apr 29, 2010 02:38PM badmamajama wrote: Didn't have a bye bye boobie party. I am planning a "Boobietaunt" this summer, a fun away to debut the new girls. My theme song will be Bad Mama Jama(yes that is how I chose my screen name here).I had alot of suggestions for the theme but I wanted to feel "All sexy and Sassy". As you girls know those feelings are hard to come by during treatment,surgery etc. Now I play the song when I need a boost or a giggle.
